FacilityName: Linn Cooperative Oil Co.  Newhall Plant
ParentCompanyName: Linn Cooperative Oil Co.  Marion, Iowa
SafetyInspectionBy: Iowa Dept.of Agriculture and Land Stewardship

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:
 This facility complies with OSHA (29 CFR 1910.111) requirements for Anhydrous Ammonia storage
and it our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to
occur, it is our policy to notify the Newhall Fire Dept. and the Benton Co. LEPC, and request that they
respond to our emergency.

Facility description and regulated substance handled:
  This facility is a farm fertilizer plant.  We sell and apply dry and liquid fertilizer.  Our Anhydrous Ammonia
plant consists of two storage tanks (26,000 and 30,000 gal.) and associated piping, compressor pump,
valves, vents, nurse tanks, and other miscellaneous equipment.

Worst Case release scenario:
  Our worst case scenario is a sudden failure of our largest storage tank when filled to maximum allowed
(SOP 85% full) , resulting in a toxic gas cloud.  According to EPA look-up tables, the distance to the
endpoint is 4.4 miles.  Within the distance to the endpoint are private residences,  schools, a recreation
area, some small businesses, including farms.   Population within the endpoint is 1,614

Alternative release scenario:
  A more likely scenario would be a transfer hose failure, resulting in a small toxic gas cloud.
According to EPA look-up tables, the distance to the endpoint is 0.5 mile.
Within that distance are private residences and some farms. 
Population within the endpoint is 28.

General accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps:
  This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule as well as all applicable local and state codes
and regulations.  This Anhydrous Ammonia plant is designed, built and maintained according to OSHA
(29 CFR 1910.111) and state regulations.

Five-year accident history:
  No accidents involving NH3 that caused death, injuries, environmental or property damage, or evacuations.

Planned changes to improve Safety: None at this time

Emergency Resp

onse program:
  It is our policy that in the event of an emergency involving NH3, the Newhall Fire Dept. and the Benton Co.
LEPC be notified of, and requested to respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this with the
Fire Dept. and the LEPC.  The Fire Dept. has a copy of our Emergency Action Plan and also inspects
our facility on a yearly basis.
